review: As an Amazon Fire TV user, I wanted to get the Fire Stick for a small tv we are putting in our kitchen (without cable) but it was out of stock.  So I bought this to try.  Overall, it was adequate, but I returned it and got the Amazon Fire TV instead.Pros- Great channel selection (more than Amazon Fire TV, but we decided Amazon has all the channels we would want; we're not HBO Go people so lack of that didn't matter)- Better UI than Amazon Fire TV.  I like that you can select your channel favorites.  And the Amazon Fire TV UI carousel will have to change (I assume Amazon is working on that since a lot of people have complained about that)Cons- Remote isn't as elegant as Fire TV or Apple TV - after using both Fire and Apple remotes, this one feels like it's a decade behind in quality, comfort and ease of use- Sluggish performance.  The Fire TV has beefier specs, and it shows.  The boot time on Roku is slow and program loading is much slower that Fire TV.

author: Ian C

review: Fantastic device.  I live in the bush country of Alaska and this unit gives me the opportunity to have an occasional movie.  Since open network cable TV is very limited here and of terrible quality and satellite service is not available this is the only option other than having DVDs mailed to me.  Using a laptop connect card, a wifi adaptor, and this unit I can finally get decent movies streaming to my TV.  Excellent price for what you get and the set up was pretty straight forward and easy.  I like this unit and would recommend it to anyone, especially if you are mobile like I am and travel a good deal.  With this unit you just take it with you and plug it in at your next destination.  Recommended.
